todoproject package#

Submodules#

todoproject.task module#

This module provides the Task and TaskList classes for managing tasks.

class todoproject.task.CriticalTask(task_id: int, name: str, description: str, deadline: datetime)[source]#

Bases: Task

Represents a critical task that inherits from Task.

This class extends the Task class with a ‘Critical’ priority level and a deadline attribute.

Parameters:

  • task_id (int) – Unique identifier for the task.

  • name (str) – Name of the task.

  • description (str) – Description of the task.

  • deadline (str or datetime) – Deadline for the critical task (in the format “%Y-%m-%d” or as a datetime object).

deadline#

Deadline for the critical task.

Type:

datetime

Note

The ‘deadline’ attribute can be set as a string in “%Y-%m-%d” format or as a datetime object.

property deadline: datetime#

Getter for the deadline attribute.

exception todoproject.task.ErreursToDo(message: str = 'An error occurred')[source]#

Bases: Exception

Custom exception for our project.

class todoproject.task.Task(task_id: int, name: str, description: str)[source]#

Bases: object

Represents a task with attributes for Id, name, and description.

This class provides methods to mark tasks as completed and update their name and description.

task_id#

Unique identifier for the task.

Type:

int

name#

Name of the task.

Type:

str

description#

Description of the task.

Type:

str

date#

Date of task creation.

Type:

datetime

modif_date#

Date of the last modification.

Type:

datetime

completed#

Indicates if the task is completed.

Type:

bool

category#

Category of the task.

Type:

str

priority#

Priority level of the task.

Type:

str

complete() → None[source]#

Mark the task as completed.

update(name: str, description: str) → None[source]#

Update the task’s name and description.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – New name for the task.

  • description (str) – New description for the task.

class todoproject.task.TaskList[source]#

Bases: object

Manage list of tasks to add, complete, remove, and display them.

tasks#

List of tasks.

Type:

list

task_id_counter#

Counter to track the next available task ID.

Type:

int

add_task(name: str, description: str, critical: bool = False, deadline: datetime = None) → None[source]#

Add a task to the list and update the task ID.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of the task.

  • description (str) – Description of the task.

  • critical (bool) – If the task is critical or not

  • deadline (datetime or str) – Deadline for critical tasks

complete_task(task_id: int) → None[source]#

Mark the first task with the given name as completed.

Parameters:

task_id (int) – Id of the task to complete.

display_tasks() → str[source]#

Display tasks, or indicate no tasks if it’s the case.

remove_task(task_id: int) → None[source]#

Remove a task by its Id.

Parameters:

task_id (int) – Id of the task to remove.
